goalForm.createSubtitle: Define your investment goal using the SMART framework

step1.title: What's your goal?
step1.subtitle: Be specific about what you want to achieve. A clear goal is the first step to success.
step1.titlePlaceholder: e.g., House down payment, Emergency fund, Dream vacation
step1.titleError: Please enter a goal title (at least 3 characters)
step1.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe your goal in detail. What exactly do you want to achieve? The more specific, the better.
step1.descriptionError: Please be specific about your goal (at least 20 characters)
step1.smartTipText: Instead of "save money", try "Save $50,000 for a down payment on a 3-bedroom house in Austin". Specific goals are easier to plan and track.

step2.title: Set your target
step2.subtitle: How much do you need to achieve this goal?
step2.amountError: Please enter a valid amount greater than 0
step2.smartTipText: Giving your goal a specific dollar amount makes it real. You can't track progress towards "saving some money", but you can track progress towards $10,000.

step3.title: When do you need it?
step3.subtitle: Set a realistic deadline. A goal without a date is just a dream.
step3.dateError: Please select a date in the future
step3.smartTipText: A deadline creates a sense of urgency and helps you calculate exactly how much you need to save each month to reach your goal.

step4.title: Categorize your goal
step4.subtitle: Which bucket does this goal fit into? This helps determine the right investment strategy.
step4.smartTipText: Different goals require different investment strategies. Safety goals need low risk. Growth goals balance risk and reward. Dream goals can afford higher risk.

step5.title: Why does this matter?
step5.subtitle: Connect your goal to an emotional anchor. This is what will keep you going when saving gets tough.
step5.whyPlaceholder: e.g., I want to provide financial security for my family, or I want to have the freedom to travel the world.
step5.smartTipText: A relevant goal matters to you and aligns with your other relevant goals. If the goal isn't important, you won't stick to it.
step5.example1: To have peace of mind knowing I can handle unexpected expenses.
step5.example2: To build a legacy for my children and their education.
step5.example3: To enjoy my retirement years without financial stress.
step5.example4: To have the freedom to pursue my passion projects.
